Resources

Course Resources

This page contains links to tools, APIs, documentation, and other resources useful for Android development.

Development Tools

Android Studio

  • Official IDE: Android Studio
  • Documentation: Android Studio User Guide
  • Download: Free (with optional paid features)

Java Development Kit (JDK)

  • Download: Oracle JDK
  • Alternative: OpenJDK
  • Required Version: Java 17 or higher

Version Control

  • Git: Official Git Website
  • GitHub: GitHub Desktop
  • Documentation: GitHub Guides

Android Development Documentation

Official Android Documentation

  • Developer Guide: Android Developers
  • API Reference: Android API Documentation
  • Samples: Android Samples on GitHub
  • Codelabs: Google Codelabs

Key Topics

  • Activities
  • Services
  • Content Providers
  • Broadcast Receivers
  • Fragment Guide
  • Layouts and Views

Libraries & Frameworks

Networking

  • Retrofit: Retrofit Documentation
  • OkHttp: OkHttp Guide
  • Volley: Android Volley

Database & Persistence

  • Room: Room Persistence Library
  • SQLite: SQLite Official
  • Firebase: Firebase Firestore

UI & Design

  • Material Design: Material Design Guidelines
  • AndroidX: AndroidX Overview
  • Jetpack Compose: Compose Documentation

Asynchronous Programming

  • Coroutines: Kotlin Coroutines Guide
  • RxJava: RxJava Documentation
  • LiveData: LiveData Overview

Testing & Debugging

Testing Frameworks

  • JUnit: JUnit 4
  • Espresso: Espresso Testing Guide
  • Mockito: Mockito Documentation
  • Robolectric: Robolectric Guide

Debugging Tools

  • Android Studio Debugger: Debug Your App
  • Logcat: View Logs with Logcat
  • Android Profiler: Profile Your App Performance

APIs & Services

Google APIs

  • Google Maps API: Maps Platform
  • Location Services: Google Play Services Location API
  • Firebase: Firebase Console

Public APIs

  • Open Weather Map: API Documentation
  • REST Countries: API Documentation
  • JSONPlaceholder: Fake API for Testing
